body.name: ASUS Dual NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 OC Edition Gaming Graphics Card (PCIe 4.0, 8GB GDDR6 Memory, HDMI 2.1, DisplayPort 1.4a, Axial-tech Fan Design, Dual BIOS, Protective Backplate, GPU Tweak II)
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by IT Electronix.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 4 hrs 11 mins.
features: NVIDIA Ampere Streaming Multiprocessors: The building blocks for the world’s fastest, most efficient GPU, the all-new Ampere SM brings 2X the FP32 throughput and improved power efficiency.
2nd Generation RT Cores: Experience 2X the throughput of 1st Gen RT Cores, plus concurrent RT and shading for a whole new level of ray tracing performance.

3rd Generation Tensor Cores: Get up to 2X the throughput with structural sparsity and advanced AI algorithms such as DLSS. Now with support for up to 8K resolution, these cores deliver a massive boost in game performance and all-new AI capabilities.
Axial-Tech Fan Design has been tuned up with more fan blades for increased downward air pressure.
GPU Tweak II provides intuitive performance tweaking, thermal controls, and system monitoring.
body.description: Delivering the latest NVIDIA Ampere architecture experience in its purest form, the ASUS DUAL GeForce RTX 3070 melds performance and simplicity like no other. Leveraging advanced cooling technologies derived from flagship graphics cards, the Dual opts for substance over style, the perfect choice for a well-balanced build. Buckle up and engage cutting-edge gaming prowess.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.7 4.7 out of 5 stars 261 ratings 4.7 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Like New RTX 3070 GPU
reviews.reviewText: Product recieved as described and has been running strong with no issue. Great value and quality for how overpriced the market has been for GPU's lately.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A nice "smaller" version RTX 3070
reviews.reviewText: Due to the thickness of the 3000 series cards, I found my choices lie somewhere between slim (pun intended) and none when it comes to finding a card that would fit inside my NZXT H210 case. It fit like a glove and performs as advertised. Looks great. Paired with an 8700k and 16gb of ram @ 3200mhz I'm getting 144 fps in benchmarks for Hitman 3 with everything maxed out except super sampling. No complaints performance, it's a welcome step up from my 1070. I didn't prefer over paying but that's the market right now and these have gone up in price considerably since I purchased it anyhow.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product, price is ehhh.
reviews.reviewText: The product itself is excellent. I bought it as a gift. The recipient was estatic and initial benchmarks blew away the 1060 it was replacing.Make sure you have enough power to feed this thing. Takes two 8(6+2) pin PCIe connectors. I don't recommend using a splitter as that power draw will stress that single cable and cause serious heat. Also, if your motherboard doesn't have a reinforced PCIex16 connector then look into getting a btace bar for vertical setups. This GPU has some weight to it.The price is inflated. As is the market right now. But, like I said, it was gift so i threw down against that judgement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible card for the price
reviews.reviewText: Replaced a 1070 with this card and the results are incredible. Now able to run everything at max settings without any issues. Love the dual modes (quiet and performance) and the fact that the fans don’t kick in unless the card hits 55C. The lighting is very subtle but adds a nice extra touch. Unfortunately Aura Sync doesn’t recognize the card...so it’s stuck on stock settings for lighting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Buy it instantly, if you get it under 600$.
reviews.reviewText: Just love this card, Cheap, Fast, Good-looking, only problem is, it's hard to get at MSRP.Well, I paid 580$ and for that pricepoint this GPU is a beast.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great card/Great performance
reviews.reviewText: I have a 1440p ultrawide monitor and this card handles all games like a champ. All the games that I play at ultra settings with no problem and high frames. (COD 120+ FPS, Doom Eternal 120+ FPS, Assassins Creed Valhalla 60+ FPS)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars 1440P At Ultra Most Game 60fps
reviews.reviewText: To begin with this would be receiving a 4 Start review if it hadn't been for the MSRP increase. Some of these prices for just a 3070 have gotten ridiculous. Some 3070's going for more than 800 dollars with tax. This was a fair price, although it seems that most people want it bad enough it doesn't matter what it costs, and I believe the AIB's have taken advantage of that. This was the final piece for one of my builds. I did a lot of testing with it including running some triple AAA games. Cyberpunk runs really well at 1440p. I wouldn't run it at Ultra though unlike people are saying because when u get into some heavy firefights, Frames take a dip. If want a constant 60+fps then I would suggest running it at High with some of the settings on Ultra.I like the accent of the RGB, really subtle. I seem to also have gotten a somewhat decent bin on it with a OC. I run at stock just seeing if this one won the silicon lottery. Not the best, but not the worst. Can't expect more for a bargain card $100 over the MSRP.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2021
reviews.reviewText: This RTX 3070 is working great and at the price I paid, very happy with is performance. I have 2 RTX 3080's but those range from $1500 - $1900 ea so I am glad I got these!

reviews.reviewTitle: Es real y sí te llega.
reviews.reviewText: Me gustó mucho la tarjeta, la verdad el precio de todas las tarjetas gráficas ha estado en aumento sin distinción, estaba entre esta y la amd 5700xt, si ven los precios están casi igual, obviamente me decanté por esta al ser mucho mejor, es más, hasta la 2080ti sigue más cara que la rtx 3070, a pesar de que ha sido superada y ser más "viejita", compruébenlo.Vale la pena y la recomiendo al 100 por ciento.
You get what you pay for when it comes to GPU'S. Not bad at all though for performance, Have had no issues yet. Looks really nice, wish I could link the RGB to my Aura or ICUE though.

Die Karte ist gut verarbeitet und sieht hübsch aus. Sie ist daher auch gut für Gehäuse mit einer Glasscheibe geeignet. Der LED-Streifen wäre in RGB noch besser, die Farbe stört mich allerdings auch nicht, da sie zu meinem Schema passt.Der aktuelle Preis lässt natürlich zu wünschen übrig. Wenn man Sie aber, so wie ich, zum UVP bekommt würde ich sofort erneut zuschlagen.Zur Leistung kann ich nur sagen: Was ein Gerät!Fast alle Spiele gehen in den höchsten Einstellungen und mit über 100 FPS.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 18, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: Beast of a card at RRP
reviews.reviewText: Managed to pick this up for £374 plus import fees of £80, way cheaper than I ever could have hoped for in the UK. I'm running it undervolted at .875mv and at a steady 1965mhz in a MicroATX build with two 140mm bequiet Pure Wings 2 fans and three 120mm fans of the same make and model. It's not gone above 62 degrees at maximum load.In short, it's an absolute beast. Runs anything maxed out at 1080p, 144fps; 1440p, 60fps. At RRP, a very good card if you're not looking for 4K gaming.
